hypothesis_content.title: UK Regulatory Transition Gap-Fill to Stress
hypothesis_content.statement: During the 2024-2027 UK regulatory transition period, any gap between BTC spot and futures prices exceeding 2.5% that coincides with FCA consultation deadlines will close violently within 5 trading days, triggering NEUTRAL-to-STRESS regime when funding rates turn negative.
hypothesis_content.rationale: UK regulatory uncertainty during multi-year transition creates structural arbitrage opportunities. FCA deadlines force market maker repositioning, exacerbating gaps. Negative funding indicates forced liquidation pressure.
entry_conditions: BTC perpetual futures premium/discount vs spot > |2.5%|
Within 5 trading days of FCA consultation deadline
Aggregate funding rates across top 5 exchanges turn negative

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Gap widens to >4% against position direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Gap persists >5 days without convergence despite negative funding OR gap direction contradicts regulatory impact (e.g., UK-positive news creates negative premium).
